summary: An email chain between FBI agents and federal prosecutors regarding a threat assessment requested by an attorney for Tova Noel, a former Epstein jail guard. The threat, sent from a Las Vegas email address, is forwarded for investigation and potential subpoena to Google.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Attorney from Foy & Seplowitz LLC who forwards a threatening email received by his partner to federal authorities, requesting a threat assessment for his client Tova Noel.

persons.name: James Seplowitz
persons.context: Partner of Jason Foy who initially received the threatening email, which was then forwarded to authorities.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Referred to as 'the victim' and a 'former Epstein guard'; her attorney is requesting an FBI threat assessment due to a perceived threat against her safety.

persons.name: Eric Sarraga
persons.context: Copied on the internal email between attorneys Jason Foy and James Seplowitz regarding the threatening message.

connections.description: Partners at the law firm Foy & Seplowitz LLC, as indicated in the email signature and forwarding chain.
Jason Foy is acting as attorney for Tova Noel, requesting an FBI threat assessment on her behalf.

events.title: Threatening email received
events.description: An email perceived as a threat against Tova Noel is sent from 'Vegas Army Vet' to attorney James Seplowitz.

events.title: Request for threat assessment
events.description: Attorney Jason Foy formally requests the Government (FBI/US Attorney's Office) to investigate the perceived threat against his client Tova Noel.

events.title: FBI coordination on threat
events.description: FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys coordinate to assess the threat, discuss generating a subpoena to Google for subscriber information, and consider a Non-Disclosure Order (NDO).

locations: New York (referenced as NY FBI and USANYS)
keyFacts: Tova Noel, a former guard at the jail where Jeffrey Epstein was held, was the subject of a perceived threat in May 2021.
The threatening email originated from a Las Vegas email address, with the sender having no criminal history according to an initial OIG check.
Federal authorities (FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office) coordinated to conduct a threat assessment and considered issuing a subpoena to Google for account information.
The document reveals ongoing security concerns and legal proceedings involving staff associated with the Epstein case years after his death.
